section.title: Manage flavors
section.para: In OpenStack, flavors define the compute, memory, and storage capacity of nova computing instances. To put it simply, a flavor is an available hardware configuration for a server. It defines the size of a virtual server that can be launched.
A flavor consists of the following parameters:

listitem.para: Number of virtual CPUs to use.
Amount of RAM to use (in megabytes).
Amount of disk space (in gigabytes) to use for the root (/) partition.

Ephemeral disks offer machine local disk storage linked to the lifecycle of a VM instance. When a VM is terminated, all data on the ephemeral disk is lost. Ephemeral disks are not included in any snapshots.
Amount of swap space (in megabytes) to use. If unspecified, the value is 0 by default.
m1.tiny (1 VCPU/0 GB Disk/512 MB RAM)
m1.smaller (1 VCPU/0 GB Disk/1024 MB RAM)
m1.small (1 VCPU/10 GB Disk/2048 MB RAM)
m1.medium (2 VCPU/10 GB Disk/3072 MB RAM)
m1.large (4 VCPU/10 GB Disk/8192 MB RAM)
m1.xlarge (8 VCPU/10 GB Disk/8192 MB RAM)

section.para: You can manage flavors with the nova flavor-* commands provided by the python-novaclient package.

step.para: When you list flavors, the list shows the ID and name, the amount of memory, the amount of disk space for the root partition and for the ephemeral partition, the swap, and the number of virtual CPUs for each flavor.
When you create a flavor, you must specify the flavor name, ID, RAM size, disk size, and the number of VCPUs. For optional parameters, see nova help flavor-create.

screen.userinput: nova flavor-create FLAVOR_NAME FLAVOR_ID RAM_IN_MB ROOT_DISK_IN_GB NUMBER_OF_VCPUS
